channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Takes on Girl with a Pearl Earring, an Ancient Bronze Returns to Turkey, and the Gold Toilet Whodunit
item.description: In the news are smiles in The Hague and tears in Cleveland. Plus where did 227 pounds of gold go?

item.title: It Isn’t A ‘Crisis’ For Trump To Fire Flag Officers, It’s A Crisis To Think He Can’t
item.description: Trump's decision to fire flag officers isn’t a break with American law and tradition. The warning about a crisis is the crisis.

item.title: A Good Start by Tulsi Gabbard
item.description: She got the first big thing right: protecting our technology industry and all Americans from the Luddite demands of Britain’s Labour government.

item.title: Trump Administration Will ‘Take Action’ If Keir Starmer-Led U.K. Censors Americans
item.description: Recently, Vance pointed out that many European countries censor their own citizens because they are afraid of them.

item.title: The FBI Raided Her Home by Mistake. Will the Supreme Court Provide Justice?
item.description: Denied appeal by lower courts for a SWAT raid gone wrong at her house, Atlanta mom Trina Martin now seeks recompense at the nation’s highest court.

item.title: Zelensky Isn’t Serious About Making A Peace Deal
item.description: Volodymyr Zelensky squandered an opportunity and his people will continue to die if he doesn't learn to show some humility and gratitude.

item.description: "Instead what we see, in the first month and a half of this new administration, the conflict is between the U.S. and its allies."

item.title: Americans’ Trust In The Propaganda Press Has Literally Never Been Lower: Poll
